articles.author: ERIC TUCKER and AAMER MADHANI
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — A ruling by the top United Nations court ordering Israel to halt its military offensive in the southern Gaza city of Rafah has deepened its disconnect with the United States over an operation that faces mounting international condemnation but that American officials describe, at least for now, as limited and targeted.
articles.title: UN court order demanding Israel to halt Gaza offensive further isolates US position

articles.author: SAM MEDNICK, LEE KEATH and SAMY MAGDY
articles.description: TEL AVIV, Israel (AP) — Egypt said Friday it has agreed to send United Nations humanitarian aid trucks through Israel’s main crossing into Gaza, but it was unclear if they will be able to enter the territory as fighting raged in the southern city of Rafah amid Israel’s escalating offensive there.
articles.title: Egypt agrees to send aid trucks through Israeli crossing to Gaza but impact is unclear

articles.author: ASHOK SHARMA
articles.description: NEW DELHI (AP) — Millions of Indians are voting Saturday in the next-to-last round of a grueling national election with a combined opposition trying to rattle Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s campaign for a third-consecutive term for himself and his Hindu nationalist party.
articles.title: Millions vote in India's grueling election with Prime Minister Modi's party likely to win a 3rd term

articles.author: ROD McGUIRK
articles.description: MELBOURNE, Australia (AP) — An emergency convoy was delivering food, water and other provisions Saturday to stunned survivors of a landslide that devastated a remote village in the mountains of Papua New Guinea and was feared to have buried scores of people, officials said.
articles.title: Emergency convoy takes provisions to survivors of devastating landslide in Papua New Guinea

articles.author: ERIC TUCKER
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Federal prosecutors on Friday asked the judge overseeing the classified documents case against Donald Trump to bar the former president from public statements that “pose a significant, imminent, and foreseeable danger to law enforcement agents” participating in the prosecution.
articles.title: Prosecutors seek to bar Trump from statements endangering law enforcement in classified records case

articles.author: RICHARD LARDNER and BILL BARROW
articles.description: OPELIKA, Ala. (AP) — On the second floor of a single-family home in a sprawling suburban development, a three-member production crew sat behind banks of computer monitors and guided the conservative Right Side Broadcasting Network’s coverage of a recent Donald Trump rally.
articles.title: Trump TV: Internet broadcaster beams the ex-president's message directly to his MAGA faithful

articles.author: JIM VERTUNO
articles.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — Families in Uvalde took more legal action Friday on the second anniversary of the Robb Elementary School attack, suing Meta Platforms, which owns Instagram, and the maker of the video game Call of Duty over claims the companies bear responsibility for products used by the teenage gunman.
articles.title: Uvalde families sue Meta and Call of Duty maker on second anniversary of school attack

articles.author: DÁNICA COTO and JIM SALTER
articles.description: The local director of a mission group in Haiti and a missionary couple from the U.S. were attacked and fatally shot by gang members after leaving a youth group activity at a church, a family member told The Associated Press.
articles.title: What we know about the young missionaries and religious leader killed in Haiti

articles.author: ADRIAN SAINZ and JONATHAN MATTISE
articles.description: MEMPHIS, Tenn. (AP) — The catalyst behind the failed gambit to sell off the iconic Graceland property in Memphis is a mystery.The self-styled investment company also is under fire from a lawsuit alleging fraud, an aggressive attorney general and a community of Elvis Presley loyalists who consider the home-turned-museum of the the king of rock n’ roll to be sacred ground.
articles.title: Failed Graceland sale by a mystery entity highlights attempts to take assets of older or dead people

articles.author: GERALD IMRAY
articles.description: CAPE TOWN, South Africa (AP) — The focus for South Africa's national election next week is on the fate of the African National Congress party and whether it is going to lose its parliamentary majority for the first time, as many expect.
articles.title: It's possible no party will get a majority in South Africa's election. Here's what that would mean
